trial_identification.studytitle: Central Venous Pressure Estimation by Compression Sonography
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Central Venous Pressure Estimation by Compression Sonography in patients with central venous catheters

interventions.interventions: Non invasive central venous pressure measurement by compression sonography (veins are compressed with an ultrasound probe until the opposite sides touch). Measurements will be repeated until a consistent result is obtained (no resting period). The procedure is estimated to take 10 minutes. There is no specific time for when this measurements will be taken (it will be based upon mutual convenience).
interventions.comparator: Invasive measurement of central venous pressure via a central venous catheter (invasive CVP is performed continuously for intensive care patients until discharge).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Correlation of central venous pressure measurement by compression sonography with invasive measurement
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Invasely measured CVP will be recorded at time of measuring CVP by compression sonography, at the end of the data collection phase

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Learning effect by researchers on correlation of measurements by comparing the results from the first half of the patients with the second half.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At end of data collection phase.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Intensive Care patients with central venous catheter

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Hypothesis - central venous pressure measurement by compression sonography correlates with central venous pressure measurement by invasive methods

ethicscommitee.ethicname: South Metropolitan Health Service Human Research Ethics Committee

contact.name: Adrian Goudie
